data.title: Great Staff, very welcoming
data.text: I only stayed a night, but the staff were very accommodating and most helpful. They did a good job anticipating what I needed (Parking validated, internet password, etc.) I very much enjoyed my stay, lovely hotel.

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your great review of us.  I will pass your comments along to my staff.  Hope to see you again if ever in the area and have a great Holiday Season.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Horrible customer service
data.text: Room was not available at 3pm check in time. After the person in our room advised they were not leaving, it took another hour to get a room. $25 credit card fee, not disclosed and we were double charged for our room

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Sorry Kimr8722wv for any inconvenience we may have caused.  Thanks for the review and have a safe and happy Holiday Season.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good location for downtown activities
data.text: We arrived at 2:45 pm Friday afternoon for a one night stay.  Check in time is 3:00 pm, but we were allowed to check in anyway.  Rooms were adequately furnished and beds were good.  The Coke vending machines on the four floors that we checked (out of 8 floors) were almost completely empty, had to settle for cherry Coke or Mello Yellow.  Coke, Diet Coke and Sprite were sold out.  The bar staff was friendly and attentive early in the evening, but staff changed while we were at an event at the civic center.  Many more people later in the evening and only two people working.  While not in the hotels control, the trains blasting their horns at all hours of the night is disruptive.  Parking ramp in kind of attached to hotel, but no direct access to rooms.  Have to go down to ground floor on parking ramp, go though sets of doors, then go down 8-10 steps to get back by the hotel lobby where the elevators to the rooms are located.

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review of us.  Sorry about the pop.  Have a great Holiday Season and hope we can see you again if ever in the area.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Location...Horrible Service
data.text:
I reserved and checked into an Executive Suite at the Radisson Hotel in Bismarck North Dakota on Tuesday Oct 22,2016. I was in town on business so I wanted a lot of space to prepare for a civil case two days later. They didn't have any rooms avail that Wednesday so I had to say at another hotel for that day but I was expected to check back into the Radisson after my case that Thursday Oct 24th. Upon attempting to check in, the receptionist told me that my room was ready and gave me a key. I didn't question the room type because I booked the Executive Suite. I was surprised when I entered the room and it was a tiny room with a queen bed. I immediately went downstairs and asked for the room i reserved. I was told that in order to get the Executive Suite they would have to bump someone down to my room  in order to accommodate me. 
Basically he told me that I was bumped down to accommodate another guest even though I had a reserved and paid for my room. I told him I refuse to be treated like that and I was checking out and going to another hotel.
The gentleman told me to let him know where i wanted to go, and he would have the shuttle bus take me. On my way to the Marriott the driver pulled over and said "this is not the Marriott but I have to drop you off here." I was stunned. He literally pulled all of my luggage and placed it in the middle of the parking and drove off. I couldn't believe that happened. 
I made my way to the hotel lobby and asked for directions. They offered to keep my luggage while I walk three long ND blocks to the Marriott. After arriving at the Marriott and checked in, the awesome receptionist Samantha went and picked up my luggage. 
That evening my card declined and after speaking with my bank I found out that The Radisson charged me for the room. When i called the Radisson , the manager told me that they had no idea i checked out. As a matter of fact, he thought I was in the hotel. I asked for a full refund and I still haven't seen it yet.

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Samantha, truly sorry for any inconvenience we may have caused.  Thank you for your comments this helps us improve our service.  Have a great Holiday Season.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Visiting Bismarck, ND on business
data.text: I attended a two-day conference at the hotel in Bismarck, ND.  Everything went well, and I enjoyed my stay. Compliments to your excellent staff--from the people at the front desk, to the restaurant server, and especially the housekeeping staff.  They kept my room in great shape!

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Sean thank you for the 5 star review of us.  Always great to hear we made your stay.  Hope to see you back with us if ever in the area, also have a great Holiday Season.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Downtown Bismarck, ND
data.text: We had excellent service in a great location in downtown Bismarck, ND, at the Radisson Hotel there. Downtown Bismarck has become rather hip, so we enjoyed staying there. The hotel was great, although the parking structure is cumbersome.

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Lee, thank your for staying with us.  We like to hear all comments about us and glad you were very happy.  Have a great Holiday Season and hope to see you again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wedding Party in Bismarck
data.text: While convenient to downtown Bismarck and its shops and restaurants, hotel is overpriced, rooms are small, and sleep number beds were uncomfortable. The Terrace Restaurant serves a great Sunday brunch and staff actually set-up a room for the wedding party to eat in.

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Rocklyn, thank you for the review.  Hope to see you again sometime and have a great Holiday Season.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great location
data.text: Slightly dated but I have seen some updates since I first started staying here in 2009.  They have a new work out room that is nothing too outstanding, but at least they have updated the equipment which is nice.  They have great beds so you will sleep really well and the staff are friendly.  The main reason I always stay here is the location.  It is in walking distance to all of the downtown shops and restaurants so you really can't go wrong.

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for all your stays with us.  You have a great Holiday Season and see you next time.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Train horns all night
data.text: No fridge in room or microwave.  No am breakfast and MCD in walking distance staffed by incompetants in AM, evening better.  Still the train came by blairing the horn every 45-75mins all night long.  Also the Sleep Number beds were broke, repaired, and tge most uncomfortable things ever.  Its a total skip!

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Truly sorry for your stay with us.  On the bright side of things the trains will stop blowing their horns by the end of the month.  Please give us another chance to make it up to you if ever in the area.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

user_location.name: Santo Domingo de Heredia, Costa Rica

data.title: Double charged and no apologies from the staff, very loud train nearby, not worth the money
data.text: I attended a wedding reception at your Bismarck, North Dakota hotel the evening of October 29, 2016.  I booked a hotel room through Hotels.com for the same night and I chose to be billed at the hotel location upon check in.  I was charged twice for the reservation by your location, once during check in and when I checked out.  When I contacted the front desk regarding the billing error, I received no apologies and I was told that I needed to call back because no manager works on Sunday.  While I can understand that no manager is available when I called, I do not understand why the person I spoke to was so rude and unapologetic.  Needless to say, I will never stay at a Radisson hotel ever again.  And i'll be sure to post an appropriate review of their facilities so others can know how unprofessional their staff is.  Rooms were small, the train is very loud, and it was expensive.

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Nathalia, I can only say sorry thought we had everything taken care of your issues. 
Not what we stand for.  Thanks for the comments.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: If you love the sound of trains stay here.
data.text: The only good thing about this property is the can service. Way too noisey and in big need of renovation . Lamps have outlets for your charging needs and they are all worn out. The warm water is just that warm not hot.

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Daniel thank you for your review.  Would like to say to you and everyone the trains will be silent next month.  That is great news for this hotel and the guest that use us.  Would hope you can give us another chance to make it up to you.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: I stay here for business every year because of the close proximity to downtown. The past 2 years I have been put in a tiny, extremely outdated room.  Also, the hotel advertises that they have Sleep Number beds.  There was not one in my room!  I stayed there on a Wednesday and Thursday night and made my reservation well in advance.  I definitely had one of the worst rooms in the hotel.  There was also hair in the sink which is just gross.

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you Sarah for the review.  Sorry for any inconvenience we may have caused.  Would hope to see you again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Small, uncomfortable, over priced rooms
data.text: Rooms are very small, beds are uncomfortable. You can hear everything in your room from the hallways to the people in the rooms next to you. Ordered room service, and we didn't get our toast, or syrup with the meal. Next morning ate in the restaurant, and everyone got their hot food before one of ours got their cold cereal we had to ask for it again.

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the review.  I will pass your comments along to my staff this only makes us better ourselves.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Super!
data.text: Overall cleanliness was a 10, decor of room modern and comfortable.  Internet was quick and easy to access.  Reasonably priced.  Convenient parking, friendly service and close to shopping and eating establishments.

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review of us.  Hope we see you again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: good
data.text: I liked this hotel! It was very clean and the staff was very nice and friendly, nicr bar and swimming pool as well.. Not really a hotel for big families with children but it is still a nice hotel for business.

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the 5 stars.  Hope to see you soon
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Keep a fan running to drown out the sounds
data.text: Certain things about this hotel are great. The bed was comfy, and the room was clean. But I (a VERY heavy sleeper) couldn't sleep because the door/walls next to the hallway were extremely loud. I could hear every door open and close. I could hear every time someone walked down the hallway, even when they weren't next to my door. The voices echoes and it was so annoying.

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Kristen thank you for your review.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: One of the worst!
data.text: Everything was terrible!  Check-in was a hassle, staff was rude, room was dirty, sleep number bed was uncomfortable, I reserved a king bed but was got a queen, room was handicap which I didn't want, shower head was like a watering can that faced straight down and wouldn't stay upright, parking is very inconvenient as well as parking process to get in and out of parking ramp, hotel grounds not well lit, hotel is like a maze.

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Patrick, sorry for any inconvenience.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Below expected standard for a Radisson hotel
data.text: The downtown location is a plus. The multi-room block rate negotiated by my company was not applied to my room rate & reception made no attempt to resolve at check-out. Small rooms and average decor are below expectations for this brand.

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Sorry for any troubles you might have had.  If the rate did not get changed please give me a shout and would gladly fix it for you.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Unhappy
data.text: Front desk personal need more training. Restraunt and bar mgr was exceptional. Sunday morning food service was good but the food flavor was below adv. the Parking and one way streets are a big negitive. The rooms should have been larger for the price too.

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for staying with us.  There are a few things we can not change like the parking and one way streets but will pass your comments along to the departments for them to review.  Hope to see you again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: never again
data.text: This hotel is very noisy. The rooms don't block out much noise. You can hear a person walking down a hallway even if they are not talking. They have sleep number beds unfortunately I don't like them. The worst nights sleep I ever had.

owner_response.author: lesch5, General Manager at Radisson Hotel Bismarck, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Sorry for any inconvenience we may have caused, not what we want to hear.  We are changing some of the Sleep Number beds.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
